question.body: If the researcher wants to estimate the number of kernels per ear from the experimental corn with a margin of error of m = 80 kernels, with 95% confidence, what is the equation to determine the minimum required number, n, of ears of corn needed in the study, according to what youâ€™ve learned thus far?

explanation.p: The formula for the minimum required sample size (in this case number of ears of corn) is n = (2σ / 80)2, where we used z = 2 for 95% confidence.
